description: System-generated unique identifier for a user account.
Login identifier used by a person or service to sign into the application.
Stored credential hash for authentication; typically hashed and salted, never plain text.
Security question prompt used for self-service account recovery.
Stored hash of the response to the security question for account recovery.
Freeâ€‘text description of the account, such as role, function, or department.
Indicates whether the account is currently locked due to security policy, typically after repeated failed sign-ins.
Indicates whether the account currently has an active session or is flagged as online.
Indicates whether the account is deactivated and cannot be used to sign in.
Timestamp when the account record was created.
Timestamp of the most recent successful sign-in.
Timestamp when the credential was last changed or reset.
Timestamp when the account was last locked out. May be null if never locked.
Number of recent unsuccessful sign-in attempts tracked for lockout policy.
Number of recent incorrect responses to the security question tracked for lockout policy.
Identifier of the user who last updated this account record; references another user.
Timestamp when this account record was last updated.
Identifier of the user who initially created this account record; references another user.
Foreign key linking the account to the corresponding person/employee profile.
Flags accounts reserved for system processes or initial setup, not a typical human user.
Indicates whether the user has signed in at least once since the last application upgrade; used for post-upgrade tasks.
User preference to display on-screen guidance for the report-building feature.
Indicates a service/API account intended for programmatic access rather than interactive use.
